Body: Possible Duplicate:  The RAM total of the apps “Running” never equals the “Used Ram” shown below on the scale  I'm owning a Nexus 7 running on 4.2.1. This is a screenshot of the amount of RAM in use. The sum of processes using the RAM is clearly less than the amount of RAM that is shown is being used. why? This is the complete list of running processes.This is the list of cached processes. Also note, under developer options the maximum number of apps running is background is limited to 4
Title: Why is there such a difference in thr amount RAM used?

history.Text: I'm owning a Nexus 7 running on 4.2.1. This is a screenshot of the amount of RAM in use. The sum of processes using the RAM is clearly less than the amount of RAM _that is shown is being used._ why?![enter image description here][1] **This is the complete list of running processes.**  [1]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/AuFXW.png
Why is there such a difference in thr amount RAM used?

I'm owning a Nexus 7 running on 4.2.1. This is a screenshot of the amount of RAM in use. The sum of processes using the RAM is clearly less than the amount of RAM _that is shown is being used._ why?![enter image description here][1] **This is the complete list of running processes.**This is the list of **cached processes.** Also note, under developer options the **maximum number of apps running is background is limited to 4**![enter image description here][2]  [1]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/AuFXW.png  [2]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/q5v2P.png

history.Comment: resized the image, if they need to see it, clicky it :)
history.Text: I'm owning a Nexus 7 running on 4.2.1. This is a screenshot of the amount of RAM in use. This is a screenshot of the amount of RAM in use. The sum of processes using the RAM is clearly less than the amount of RAM _that is shown is being used._ why?![enter image description here][1] **This is the complete list of running processes.**This is the list of **cached processes.** Also note, under developer options the **maximum number of apps running is background is limited to 4**![enter image description here][2]  [1]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/AuFXWm.png  [2]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/q5v2Pm.png
